programme.title: The Men Who Stare at Goats
Człowiek, który gapił się na kozy
The Men Who Stare at Goats
programme.desc:
The Men Who Stare at Goats: Directed by Grant Heslov. With George Clooney, Ewan McGregor, Jeff Bridges, Kevin Spacey. A reporter in Iraq might just have the story of a lifetime when he meets Lyn Cassady, a guy who claims to be a former member of the U.S. Army's New Earth Army, a unit that employs paranormal powers in their missions." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1234548/","name":"The Men Who Stare at Goats","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIwOTQwNzg1MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODc4MDU4Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A reporter in Iraq might just have the story of a lifetime when he meets Lyn Cassady, a guy who claims to be a former member of the U.S. Army's New Earth Army, a unit that employs paranormal powers in their missions.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1234548/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"C-Younkin"},"dateCreated":"2009-11-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Younkin Reviews Movies","reviewBody":""The Men Who Stare at Goats" is a fascinating subject that gets the "Saturday Night Live" treatment. It's all based on fact (from Jon Ronson's book) but the concept is so silly that director Grant Heslov and George Clooney (both worked on "Good Night, and Good Luck) really can't help but make fun of it, and there are some good laughs here. Just no real story.

Ewan McGregor plays journalist Bob Wilton, a jilted husband who goes to war to forget his backstabbing wife only to end up wiling away in Kuwait. One night he meets Lyn Cassidy (George Clooney), a familiar name to him from a previous interview he did years before about psychic-spies. Lyn was the best in what was called the "New Earth Army", started by Vietnam-Vet Bill Django (Jeff Bridges) in the 80's to create soldiers with super-powers who could prevent conflict. The Army was later dismantled and used for evil purposes by the movie's antagonist Hooper (Kevin Spacey) but Lyn tells Bob he's been re-activated, and has a secret mission to do in Iraq. Bob, thinking Lyn crazy but interesting at the same time, decides to team up with him and go where the action is. Along the way, Lyn tells him stories of others dubbed, "Jedi Warriors." 

Most of the movie is flashbacks, beginning with Iraq War 2003 and chronicling all the way back to the beginning of New Age warfare. There are weird and crazy laughs to be had like Lyn's initiation, where Django urges him he will never be a soldier unless he can free the dance. The lines are good too. "We tried invisibility but then worked it down to just not being seen", Lyn tells Bob upon their first meeting. Clooney is perfectly eccentric as a guy who lives by the mindfulness-over-warfare principal and McGregor is a whiny, but solid straight-man. Bridges is also terrific as this free-spirited hippie. Only the laughs and flashbacks (which feel like a series of sketches) aren't enough to distract from the fact that "Goats" really has no compelling narrative. The forward-moving story in Iraq 2003 has very little momentum. Spacey appears later on again as the villain but the conflict is weak and the movie has more than over-stayed its welcome.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":130167,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","War"],"datePublished":"2009-11-06","keywords":"satire,army training,iraq war,secret military operation,goat","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Paranormal Activity -- "Paranormal Goats" TV Spot","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi309003545","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgxMzI0OTM0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDgwMDg5Mg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgxMzI0OTM0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDgwMDg5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A TV trailer for the movie Paranormal Activity."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000191/","name":"Ewan McGregor"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000123/","name":"George Clooney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000228/","name":"Kevin Spacey"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0381416/","name":"Grant Heslov"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103694/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0104115/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0184096/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0740160/","name":"Jon Ronson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1661186/","name":"Peter Straughan"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 1234548, Title: The Men Who Stare at Goats, --- Description: The Men Who Stare at Goats: Directed by Grant Heslov. With George Clooney, Ewan McGregor, Jeff Bridges, Kevin Spacey. A reporter in Iraq might just have the story of a lifetime when he meets Lyn Cassady, a guy who claims to be a former member of the U.S. Army's New Earth Army, a unit that employs paranormal powers in their missions." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1234548/","name":"The Men Who Stare at Goats","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIwOTQwNzg1MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODc4MDU4Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A reporter in Iraq might just have the story of a lifetime when he meets Lyn Cassady, a guy who claims to be a former member of the U.S. Army's New Earth Army, a unit that employs paranormal powers in their missions.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1234548/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"C-Younkin","dateCreated":"2009-11-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Younkin Reviews Movies","reviewBody":""The Men Who Stare at Goats" is a fascinating subject that gets the "Saturday Night Live" treatment. It's all based on fact (from Jon Ronson's book) but the concept is so silly that director Grant Heslov and George Clooney (both worked on "Good Night, and Good Luck) really can't help but make fun of it, and there are some good laughs here. Just no real story.

Ewan McGregor plays journalist Bob Wilton, a jilted husband who goes to war to forget his backstabbing wife only to end up wiling away in Kuwait. One night he meets Lyn Cassidy (George Clooney), a familiar name to him from a previous interview he did years before about psychic-spies. Lyn was the best in what was called the "New Earth Army", started by Vietnam-Vet Bill Django (Jeff Bridges) in the 80's to create soldiers with super-powers who could prevent conflict. The Army was later dismantled and used for evil purposes by the movie's antagonist Hooper (Kevin Spacey) but Lyn tells Bob he's been re-activated, and has a secret mission to do in Iraq. Bob, thinking Lyn crazy but interesting at the same time, decides to team up with him and go where the action is. Along the way, Lyn tells him stories of others dubbed, "Jedi Warriors." 

Most of the movie is flashbacks, beginning with Iraq War 2003 and chronicling all the way back to the beginning of New Age warfare. There are weird and crazy laughs to be had like Lyn's initiation, where Django urges him he will never be a soldier unless he can free the dance. The lines are good too. "We tried invisibility but then worked it down to just not being seen", Lyn tells Bob upon their first meeting. Clooney is perfectly eccentric as a guy who lives by the mindfulness-over-warfare principal and McGregor is a whiny, but solid straight-man. Bridges is also terrific as this free-spirited hippie. Only the laughs and flashbacks (which feel like a series of sketches) aren't enough to distract from the fact that "Goats" really has no compelling narrative. The forward-moving story in Iraq 2003 has very little momentum. Spacey appears later on again as the villain but the conflict is weak and the movie has more than over-stayed its welcome.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":130167,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","War"],"datePublished":"2009-11-06","keywords":"satire,army training,iraq war,secret military operation,goat","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Paranormal Activity -- "Paranormal Goats" TV Spot","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi309003545","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgxMzI0OTM0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDgwMDg5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgxMzI0OTM0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDgwMDg5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A TV trailer for the movie Paranormal Activity.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000191/","name":"Ewan McGregor","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000123/","name":"George Clooney","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000228/","name":"Kevin Spacey"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0381416/","name":"Grant Heslov"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103694/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0104115/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0184096/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0740160/","name":"Jon Ronson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1661186/","name":"Peter Straughan"],"duration":"PT1H34M"</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: EuroTrip: Directed by Jeff Schaffer, Alec Berg, David Mandel. With Scott Mechlowicz, Jacob Pitts, Kristin Kreuk, Cathy Meils. Dumped by his girlfriend, a high school grad decides to embark on an overseas adventure in Europe with his friends." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0356150/","name":"EuroTrip","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTIxNjcxMDUxN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNjAxNTM3._V1_.jpg","description":"Dumped by his girlfriend, a high school grad decides to embark on an overseas adventure in Europe with his friends.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0356150/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Flagrant-Baronessa"},"dateCreated":"2006-07-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"This is cheesy, cliché and predictable teen-comedy at its best.","reviewBody":"Every now and then comes a teen-comedy in which the plot and plot twists are so predictable that they drag the whole movie down. This is not one of those, because while Eurotrip is certainly cliché, it is simultaneously hilarious and well worth the watch. The film has some very cheesy moments and within the first ten minutes you will probably be able to guess who ends up with whom in the end and which character goes through the biggest development. \n\nHowever, none of this matters because sometimes comes a joke in Eurotrip that is just so funny it takes your breath away. This is stuff like a creepy Italian man on the train with the American teens as they travel through Europe, and all of his lewd passes as the train enters a tunnel. Or, the fact that two of the Americans--the two twins--get so wasted that they make out with each other. Or Vinnie Jones as a Mancunian football hooligan. And lastly, we have a Matt Damon who shaved his head to sing in a band specifically for this film. If stuff like that doesn't promise an awesome movie, nothing does. 7/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":204057,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2004-02-20","keywords":"incestuous kiss,nudist,nudity,sex in a confessional,oral sex","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"EuroTrip","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2946826521","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2NjM2IwNGMtZTIzYS00NWIxLWI3NTEtZjc4ZmM4NTcxMzJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2NjM2IwNGMtZTIzYS00NWIxLWI3NTEtZjc4ZmM4NTcxMzJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for EuroTrip"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1310709/","name":"Scott Mechlowicz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0686009/","name":"Jacob Pitts"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005502/","name":"Michelle Trachtenberg"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0769840/","name":"Jeff Schaffer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0073688/","name":"Alec Berg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0541635/","name":"David Mandel"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0819670/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0118469/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0098163/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0073688/","name":"Alec Berg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0541635/","name":"David Mandel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0769840/","name":"Jeff Schaffer"}],"duration":"PT1H32M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Bug
Robak
Bug
programme.desc:
Bug: Directed by William Friedkin. With Ashley Judd, Michael Shannon, Harry Connick Jr., Lynn Collins. An unhinged war veteran holes up with a lonely woman in a spooky Oklahoma motel room. The line between reality and delusion is blurred as they discover a bug infestation." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0470705/","name":"Bug","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIzOTUzMDkzMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDY2MjMzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An unhinged war veteran holes up with a lonely woman in a spooky Oklahoma motel room. The line between reality and delusion is blurred as they discover a bug infestation.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0470705/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Leofwine_draca"},"dateCreated":"2011-01-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"A bad dream of a film","reviewBody":"BUG is a creepy psychological horror yarn directed by William Friedkin, the man behind such '70s classics as THE EXORCIST and THE FRENCH CONNECTION. Is this film in the same league as those films of yester-year? Not by a long shot. While the premise has a great deal of promise behind it, by the end this is a huge disappointment, a film that sacrifices disturbing realism for over-the-top theatrics by the climax, which is a real shame.

Theatrics is appropriate, as in the end this turns out to be adapted from a stage play, as evinced by the single-room setting. The first half is quirky and unusual, as we watch the film wondering how it's going to turn out. It flirts with a lot of themes and genres, without ever being easily pigeon-holed into a single one. Is it a psychological study of madness? Is it a creature feature horror flick? Is it a study of domestic violence, a romance, a two-hander character piece? It's all of those, but by the end the intense script falls apart and ends up tackling over-the-top sci-fi themes and becoming somewhat laughable.

One thing that does keep you watching is the calibre of the acting, which is top dollar. Ashley Judd is a fine piece of casting as the put-upon, run-down heroine, and she lends this film a sense of gravitas that would have otherwise been missing. IMDb data; ttnr: 0470705, Title: Bug, --- Description: Bug: Directed by William Friedkin. With Ashley Judd, Michael Shannon, Harry Connick Jr., Lynn Collins. An unhinged war veteran holes up with a lonely woman in a spooky Oklahoma motel room. The line between reality and delusion is blurred as they discover a bug infestation." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0470705/","name":"Bug","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIzOTUzMDkzMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDY2MjMzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An unhinged war veteran holes up with a lonely woman in a spooky Oklahoma motel room. The line between reality and delusion is blurred as they discover a bug infestation.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0470705/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Leofwine_draca","dateCreated":"2011-01-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"A bad dream of a film","reviewBody":"BUG is a creepy psychological horror yarn directed by William Friedkin, the man behind such '70s classics as THE EXORCIST and THE FRENCH CONNECTION. Is this film in the same league as those films of yester-year? Not by a long shot. While the premise has a great deal of promise behind it, by the end this is a huge disappointment, a film that sacrifices disturbing realism for over-the-top theatrics by the climax, which is a real shame.

Theatrics is appropriate, as in the end this turns out to be adapted from a stage play, as evinced by the single-room setting. The first half is quirky and unusual, as we watch the film wondering how it's going to turn out. It flirts with a lot of themes and genres, without ever being easily pigeon-holed into a single one. Is it a psychological study of madness? Is it a creature feature horror flick? Is it a study of domestic violence, a romance, a two-hander character piece? It's all of those, but by the end the intense script falls apart and ends up tackling over-the-top sci-fi themes and becoming somewhat laughable.

One thing that does keep you watching is the calibre of the acting, which is top dollar. Ashley Judd is a fine piece of casting as the put-upon, run-down heroine, and she lends this film a sense of gravitas that would have otherwise been missing. Michael Shannon is a scene-stealer, his quirky, paranoid war veteran one of the most charming performances I've seen in the past few years, and there's a neat extended cameo from Harry Connick Jr, too.

The film has plenty of strong moments, a few bits of nasty violence, and a rather silly climax. It all mixes together into a rather unsatisfactory brew by the end, but hey, at least it's different.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":34468,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Horror","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2008-03-05","keywords":"breast sucking,power of suggestion,based on play,male frontal nudity,bare breasts","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bug (2006)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2126250265","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGEzZDJjZjMtMzA4OC00ZGJmLWE2ZjgtYTc2OWI4NDcxYmRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGEzZDJjZjMtMzA4OC00ZGJmLWE2ZjgtYTc2OWI4NDcxYmRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Lionsgate","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000171/","name":"Ashley Judd","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0788335/","name":"Michael Shannon","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001065/","name":"Harry Connick Jr."],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001243/","name":"William Friedkin"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0060306/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0093132/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0312746/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0504832/","name":"Tracy Letts"],"duration":"PT1H42M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Fact or Faked: Auf den Spuren des Paranormalen
Fact or Faked: Auf den Spuren des Paranormalen
Warcraft: The Beginning
programme.desc: Picard (Patrick Stewart) will die Arbeit seines Mentors Professor Galen (Norman Lloyd) wieder aufnehmen. Dieser hatte Teile eines uralten Computerprogramms entdeckt, welches bestimmte Darstellungen von DNA-Programmen umfasst. Die fehlenden Teile befinden sich offenbar bei den Klingonen und den Kardassianern. Beide Rassen willigen ein, mit Picard zusammen zu arbeiten. Bei einem Treffen mit den Romulanern kommt eine gewagte Idee auf. Es scheint, als hätten alle Rassen den selben Ursprung.

Oblivion
programme.desc: Vor acht Jahren musste Riker bei einer Notevakuierung wichtige Daten auf dem Planeten Nervala-4 zurücklassen. Als er nun mit einem Außenteam zurückkehrt, trifft er auf einen absolut identischen Doppelgänger. Der Mann behauptet sogar, selbst Will Riker zu sein. Es stellt sich heraus, dass der Commander durch eine Transporterfehlfunktion zweimal materialisiert wurde. Es dauert nicht lange, bis es zwischen den beiden Rikers zu Spannungen kommt.
